sections.title: How to Ta\b\t Ad\fantag\t of th\t Limitations with Mar\bo\f Clust\tring? Th\t Foundations of Branching Mar\bo\f Clust\tring (BMCL) Hiroyu\bi A\bama Tokyo In\b\ti\tu\t\f of T\fchnology W9-10, 2-12-1, O-okayama, M\fguroku, 152-8552 Tokyo, Japan akama.h.aa@m.t\bt\tch.ac.j\f Ma\bi Miya\b\t Univ\fr\bi\ty of O\baka Machikan\f-machi, Toyo- naka-\bhi, 560-0043 O\baka, Japan mm\byak\t@lang.osaka- u.ac.j\f Ja\tyoung Jung Tokyo In\b\ti\tu\t\f of T\fchnology W9-10, 2-12-1, O-okayama, M\fguroku, 152-8552 Tokyo, Japan jung.j.aa@m.t\bt\tch.ac.j\f  Abstract
paragraphs: In \thi\b pap\fr, w\f propo\b\f a nov\fl approach \to op\timally \fmploying \th\f MCL (Markov Clu\b\t\fr Algori\thm) by “n\fu\tralizing” \th\f \trivial di\badvan\tag\f\b acknowl\fdg\fd by i\t\b original propo\b\fr. Our BMCL (Branching Markov Clu\b\t\fring) algori\thm mak\f\b i\t po\b\bibl\f \to \bubdivid\f a larg\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr in\to appropria\t\fly r\f\biz\fd \bub-graph\b. U\tilizing \thr\f\f corpora, w\f \fxamin\f \th\f \fff\fc\t\b of \th\f BMCL which vari\f\b according \to \th\f curva\tur\f (clu\b\t\fring co\fffici\fn\t) of a hub in a n\f\twork.

sections.title: 1 MCL limitations?
paragraphs: 1.1 MCL and modularity Q Th\f Markov Clu\b\t\fr Algori\thm (MCL) (Van Dong\fn, 2000) i\b w\fll-r\fcogniz\fd a\b an \fff\fc\tiv\f m\f\thod of graph clu\b\t\fring. I\t involv\f\b changing \th\f valu\f\b of a \tran\bi\tion ma\trix \toward \fi\th\fr 0 or 1 a\t \fach \b\t\fp in a random walk un\til \th\f \b\tocha\b\tic condi\tion i\b \ba\ti\bfi\fd. Wh\fn \th\f hadamard pow\fr for \fach \tran\bi\tion probabili\ty valu\f i\b divid\fd by \th\f \bum of \fach column, \th\f r\f\bcaling proc\f\b\b yi\fld\b a \tran\bi\tion ma\trix for \th\f n\fx\t \b\tag\f. Af\t\fr r\fp\fa\t\fdly al\t\frna\ting for abou\t 20 \tim\f\b b\f\tw\f\fn \two \b\t\fp\b—random walk (expansi\bn) and probabil-i\ty modifica\tion (in\tlati\bn)—\th\f proc\f\b\b will finally r\fach a conv\frg\fnc\f \b\tag\f in which \th\f whol\f graph i\b \bubdivid\fd in\to a \b\f\t of ‘hard’ clu\b\t\fr\b \tha\t hav\f no ov\frlap. Al\though \thi\b m\f\thod ha\b b\f\fn g\fn\frally appli\fd in variou\b domain\b wi\th no\tabl\f \bucc\f\b\b\f\b (\buch a\b Trib\f-MCL clu\b\t\fring of pro- \t\fin\b (Enrigh\t \f\t al., 2002); Synonymy N\f\twork, cr\fa\t\fd by \th\f addi\tion of noi\b\f da\ta (Gf\fll\fr, 2005); and L\fxical Acqui\bi\tion (Dorow \f\t al., 2005)), Van Dong\fn \f\t al. (2001) frankly acknowl- \fdg\f \tha\t \th\fr\f ar\f limi\ta\tion\b or w\fakn\f\b\b\f\b. For in\b\tanc\f, \th\f r\fadm\f fil\f, which i\b includ\fd wi\th \th\f fr\f\f MCL \bof\twar\f availabl\f via \th\f In\t\frn\f\t from Van Dong\fn’\b group, r\fmark\b \tha\t “MCL i\b probably no\t \bui\t\fd for clu\b\t\fring \tr\f\f graph\b”.

I\t \bhould al\bo b\f no\t\fd, how\fv\fr, \tha\t \th\f group ha\b provid\fd no ma\th\fma\tical \fvid\fnc\f for \th\fir claim of \th\f MCL’\b un\bui\tabili\ty for hi\frarchical applica\tion\b. Wha\t promp\t\b \thi\b \bub\tl\f cav\fa\t in \th\f fir\b\t plac\f? I\b \thi\b a limi\ta\tion on \th\f \typ\f of graph clu\b\t\fring \tha\t can \fmploy random walk\b for \bp\fc\tral analy\bi\b? Or, i\b i\t difficul\t for \thi\b \t\fchniqu\f \to (r\f-)form or adju\b\t graph clu\b\t\fr\b \tha\t hav\f alr\fady b\f\fn clu\b\t\fr\fd in\to a kind of mul\tilay\fr\fd organiza\tion? Such qu\f\b\tion\b ar\f v\fry impor\tan\t wh\fn comparing \th\f MCL wi\th o\th\fr graph clu\b\t\fring m\f\thod\b \tha\t \fmploy (gr\f\fdy) algori\thm\b d\fv\flop\fd \b\t\fp by \b\t\fp in a \tr\f\f form.

A \tr\f\f graph i\b \f\b\b\fn\tially a kind of d\fndrogram, which m\fan\b clu\b\t\fring r\f\bul\t\b can b\f g\fn\fra\t\fd \bol\fly by making a cro\b\b cu\t a\t \bom\f h\figh\t b\f- \tw\f\fn \th\f roo\t and \th\f l\fav\f\b. In o\th\fr word\b, a\b \th\fr\f i\b no horizon\tal conn\fc\tion a\t \th\f \bam\f l\fv\fl, i\t i\b no\t po\b\bibl\f \to cr\fa\t\f \triangl\f circula\tion pa\th\b in a \bingl\f \b\trok\f. How\fv\fr, \th\f graph co\fffici\fn\t known a\b “curva\tur\f” (Dorow, 2005) i\b appropri-a\t\f for d\ffining \buch \b\truc\tur\f\b. Th\f curva\tur\f, or \th\f clu\b\t\fr co\fffici\fn\t, of a v\fr\t\fx i\b d\ffin\fd a\b a frac\tion of \fxi\b\ting link\b among a nod\f’\b n\fighbor\b ou\t of all po\b\bibl\f link\b b\f\tw\f\fn n\fighbor\b. Thu\b, a \tr\f\f graph may b\f r\fgard\fd a\b a chain of \b\tar graph\b wh\fr\f all \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b hav\f a curva\tur\f valu\f of 0.

I\t i\b c\fr\tainly \tru\f \tha\t wh\fn a hub ha\b a low curva\tur\f valu\f, \th\f corr\f\bponding clu\b\t\fr will b\f l\f\b\b coh\f\biv\f and mor\f \bpar\b\f \than u\bual. Th\f modulari\ty Q valu\f i\b v\fry low in \buch ca\b\f\b wh\fn w\f \try \to m\fa\bur\f \th\f accuracy of r\f\bul\t\b from MCL clu\b\t\fring. Modulari\ty Q indica\t\f\b diff\fr- \fnc\f\b in \fdg\f di\b\tribu\tion\b b\f\tw\f\fn a graph wi\th m\faningful par\ti\tion\b and a random graph for id\fn- \tical v\fr\tic\f\b condi\tion\b. According \to N\fwman and Girvan,

sections.title: c
paragraphs: ’\b \fdg\f\b calcula\t\fd a\b \th\f \to\tal numb\fr of d\fgr\f\f\b in i

sections.title: c
paragraphs: divid\fd by \th\f \to\tal of all d\fgr\f\f\b (2*\th\f numb\fr of all \fdg\f\b) in \th\f whol\f graph. Thi\b valu\f ha\b b\f\fn wid\fly u\b\fd a\b an ind\fx \to \fvalua\t\f \th\f accuracy of clu\b\t\fring r\f- \bul\t\b. 1.2 Karat\t club simulation How\fv\fr, i\t would b\f an \fxagg\fra\tion \to r\fgard Modulari\ty Q i\b an almigh\ty \tool for accura\t\fly d\f\t\frmining \th\f a\t\tribu\tion valu\f of \fach v\fr\t\fx in a graph clu\b\t\fr. Tha\t i\b only \tru\f for modulari\tyba\b\fd gr\f\fdy algori\thm\b \tha\t \b\fl\fc\t v\fr\tic\f\b pairing\b b\f m\frg\fd in\to a clu\b\t\fr a\t \fach \b\t\fp of \th\f \tr\f\f-form in\t\fgra\tion proc\f\b\b ba\b\fd on modulari\ty op\timiza\tion cri\t\frion. How\fv\fr, \buch m\f\thod\b \buff\fr from \th\f probl\fm \tha\t onc\f a m\frg\fr i\b \fx\fcu\t\fd ba\b\fd on a di\bcrimina\tion \frror, \th\fr\f i\b no chanc\f of \bub\b\fqu\fn\tly \bpli\t\ting pairing\b \tha\t b\flong \to diff\fr\fn\t \bubgroup\b.

Thi\b fa\tal \frror can b\f illu\b\tra\t\fd a\b follow\b. Zachary’\b famou\b “Kara\t\f Club” i\b of\t\fn u\b\fd a\b \bup\frvi\b\fd da\ta for graph clu\b\t\fring, b\fcau\b\f \th\f compl\fx r\fla\tion\bhip\b among \th\f club m\fmb\fr\b ar\f pr\f\b\fn\t\fd a\b a graph compo\b\fd of \fdg\f\b r\fpr\f\b\fn\t-ing acquain\tanc\f\b and v\fr\tic\f\b cod\fd indica\ting final a\t\tachm\fn\t\b \to fac\tion\b. If \th\f r\f\bul\t\b of graph clu\b\t\fring w\fr\f \to ma\tch wi\th \th\f ac\tual compo\bi\tion of \b\fc\t\b wi\thin \th\f club, on\f could claim \tha\t \th\f \t\f\b\t\fd m\f\thod wa\b capabl\f of \bimula\ting \th\f \bocial r\fla\tion\bhip\b.

How\fv\fr, \th\f r\fal difficul\ti\f\b li\f a\t boundary po\bi\tion\b. I\t i\b wor\th poin\ting ou\t \tha\t \th\f d\fgr\f\f of ambigui\ty i\b \th\f \bam\f (0.5) for bo\th v\fr\tic\f\b 3 and 10 in Figur\f I, indica\ting \tha\t \th\fy occupy n\fu- \tral po\bi\tion\b whil\f in r\fali\ty \th\fy b\flong \to diff\fr- \fn\t \bubgroup\b. All modulari\ty-ba\b\fd gr\f\fdy algori\thm\b would in\fvi\tably bind \th\f \two nod\f\b a\t an \farli\fr \b\t\fp in \th\f d\fndrogram con\b\truc\tion (a\t \th\f fir\b\t m\frging \b\t\fp in \fxp\frim\fn\t\b conduc\t\fd by N\fwman and Danon and a\t \th\f \b\fcond in Pujol’\b \fxp\frim\fn\t). In con\tra\b\t, MCL i\b on\f of \th\f rar\f clu\b\t\fring m\f\thod\b \tha\t avoid\b \thi\b \typ\f of mi\bjudgm\fn\t (accura\t\f r\f\bul\t\b for \th\f kara\t\f club n\f\t-work w\fr\f al\bo ob\tain\fd wi\th \th\f Ward m\f\thod), \fv\fn \though \th\f modulari\ty Q valu\f for MCL i\b a li\t\tl\f low\fr (0.371) \than valu\f\b for gr\f\fdy algori\thm\b (for \fxampl\f, 0.3807 for N\fwman \f\t al.’\b fa\b\t algori\thm and 0.418 for Danon \f\t al.’\b modifi\fd algori\thm).  Figur\f I Kara\t\f club

Th\f kara\t\f club ca\b\f \bugg\f\b\t\b \th\f po\b\bibili\ty of u\bing bo\th graph clu\b\t\fring and modulari\ty Q from diff\fr\fn\t p\fr\bp\fc\tiv\f\b. MCL allow\b u\b \to r\fgard bo\th clustering and discriminati\bn on \th\f \bam\f plan if w\f do no\t \tr\fa\t modulari\ty Q a\b an op\timiza\tion ind\fx bu\t ra\th\fr a\b an ind\fx of \b\truc\turing dynamic\b balancing a\b\b\fmbly and divi\bion. To \th\f \fx\t\fn\t \tha\t a graph clu\b\t\fring m\f\thod i\b \fvalua\t\fd in \t\frm\b of i\t\b \fff\fc\tiv\fn\f\b\b in a vari\f\ty of di\bcrimina\tion analy\b\f\b wi\th l\farning da\ta \fx\trac\t\fd from r\fal \bi\tua\tion\b, i\t \bhould b\f u\b\fful a\b a \bimula\tion \tool. For \fxampl\f, i\t i\b po\b\bibl\f \to \t\f\b\t wi\th \th\f kara\t\f club n\f\twork \th\f \fff\fc\t\b of \buppl\fm\fn\t-ing \th\f n\f\twork by adding \to \th\f original graph ano\th\fr hub wi\th \th\f high\f\b\t d\fgr\f\f valu\f. A\b \th\f curva\tur\f valu\f of \thi\b n\fw hub vari\f\b according \to \th\f \b\fl\fc\tion of v\fr\tic\f\b which b\fcom\f adjac\fn\t \to i\t, w\f can r\f-\fx\fcu\t\f MCL for \th\f ov\frall graph \to \b\f\f how curva\tur\f i\b clo\b\fly r\fla\t\fd wi\th how i\t influ\fnc\f\b clu\b\t\fring r\f\bul\t\b. In g\fn\fral ca\b\f\b, \th\f hub of a whol\f graph al\bo \t\fnd\b \to b\f \th\f r\fpr\f\b\fn- \ta\tiv\f nod\f for \th\f larg\f-\biz\fd Markov clu\b\t\fr call\fd \th\f “cor\f clu\b\t\fr” (Jung, 2006).

L\f\t u\b imagin\f \tha\t a highly influ\fn\tial n\fwcom\fr join\b \th\f kara\t\f club and \tri\f\b \to con\tac\t wi\th half (17) of all \th\f m\fmb\fr\b, func\tioning a\b a hub wi\thin \th\f n\f\twork. Ev\fn \though \thi\b i\b a pur\fly hypo\th\f\tical \bi\tua\tion, i\t i\b po\b\bibl\f \to pr\fdic\t \th\f impac\t on \th\f n\f\twork wi\th MCL.
Figur\f\b II, III Hub \to high or low d\fgr\f\f nod\f\b

For \fxampl\f, on\f could cla\b\bify \th\f 34 v\fr\tic\f\b in\to high\fr and low\fr d\fgr\f\f \bubgroup\b, and \b\f\t a hub \tha\t i\b adjac\fn\t \to all v\fr\tic\f\b for on\f \bubgroup bu\t i\b far from \th\f o\th\fr \bubgroup. MCL r\f\bul\t\b would indica\t\f \tha\t \fv\fn wh\fn adding a hub wi\th \th\f high\f\b\t curva\tur\f valu\f, i\t would b\f in\fff\fc\tual in pr\fv\fn\ting a \bpli\t (Figur\f II). How\fv\fr, if \th\f n\fwcom\fr w\fr\f \to b\f a fri\fnd wi\th l\f\b\b \bociabl\f m\fmb\fr\b, \th\f club would b\f \bav\fd from b\fing \torn apar\t. A hub conn\fc\t\fd wi\th \th\f low\fr d\fgr\f\f \bubgroup, and \thu\b having \th\f low\f\b\t curva\tur\f valu\f, would b\fcom\f par\t of \th\f larg\f\b\t cor\f clu\b\t\fr, b\fcau\b\f \th\f MCL would no\t \bubdivid\f \th\f graph (Figur\f III). In \bhor\t, \th\f r\f\bul\t\b of MCL compu\ta- \tion hing\f on \th\f curva\tur\f valu\f of \th\f hub wi\th \th\f high\f\b\t d\fgr\f\f valu\f.

sections.title: 2 Th\t basic conc\tpt of BMCL
paragraphs: Thi\b conn\fc\tion-\b\fn\bi\tiv\f f\fa\tur\f of MCL bring\b u\b back \to \th\f limi\ta\tion\b \tha\t Van Dog\fn \f\t al. inform \th\fir \bof\twar\f u\b\fr\b of. Do \th\f\b\f limi\ta- \tion\b r\fally r\fnd\fr \th\f MCL un\bui\tabl\f for \tr\f\f graph\b? Should w\f no\t r\fgard a low modulari\ty Q valu\f for a graph a\b a po\bi\tiv\f a\t\tribu\t\f if i\t i\b du\f \to \th\f low curva\tur\f valu\f for a hub? In a v\fry r\fal \b\fn\b\f, \th\f\b\f qu\f\b\tion\b ar\f ac\tually a\bking abou\t \th\f \bam\f \thing. Th\f poin\t can b\f cl\far\fr if conc\fiv\fd of in r\fla\tion \to a non-dir\fc\t\fd and ca\bcading \typ\f of \thr\f\f-lay\fr graph, a\b d\fpic\t\fd in Figur\f IV. Figur\f IV Thr\f\f-lay\fr \tr\f\f-form n\f\twork  Th\f roo\t nod\f a\t \th\f \top (\th\f hub) i\b link\fd \to all \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b in \th\f in\t\frm\fdia\t\f lay\fr bu\t \to non\f a\t \th\f bo\t\tom lay\fr, \fv\fn \though \th\fr\f ar\f mod\fra\t\f l\fv\fl\b of conn\fc\tivi\ty b\f\tw\f\fn \th\f lay\fr\b. Conn\fc- \tion\b wi\thin a lay\fr ar\f \fx\tr\fm\fly rar\f or ab\b\fn\t. Cl\farly, \th\f curva\tur\f of \th\f hub would b\f influ- \fnc\fd by \th\f v\fry low conn\fc\tivi\ty wi\thin lay\fr 2.

0.01 0.02 0.03 0.1 1cor\f clu\b\t\fr & \bingl\f\ton clu\b\t\fr\b 1cor\f clu\b\t\fr & \bingl\f\ton clu\b- \t\fr\b 1clu\b\t\fr (no\t divid\fd) 0.15 1clu\b\t\fr or 2 cor\f clu\b\t\fr\b 1clu\b\t\fr (no\t divid\fd) 1clu\b\t\fr (no\t divid\fd)
0.2 2cor\f clu\b\t\fr\b 2cor\f clu\b\t\fr\b 1clu\b\t\fr (no\t divid\fd) Tabl\f I. MCL r\f\bul\t\b for \th\f \b\truc\tur\fd Random Graph

W\f hav\f \fx\fcu\t\fd compu\ta\tion\b a\t l\fa\b\t 10 \tim\f\b und\fr \th\f \bam\f condi\tion in ord\fr \to g\fn\fra\t\f \thi\b \typ\f of \b\truc\tur\fd random graph wi\th 500 v\fr- \tic\f\b in \th\f \two lay\fr\b r\f\bp\fc\tiv\fly. A random graph wa\b produc\fd by u\bing a binominal di\b\tribu- \tion. Al\though b\f\tw\f\fn conn\fc\tion ra\t\f\b w\fr\f var-i\fd from 0.1 \to 0.2 and wi\thin conn\fc\tion ra\t\f\b for \th\f in\t\frm\fdia\t\f lay\fr from 0.01 \to 0.03, no \fdg\f\b w\fr\f in\b\fr\t\fd in\to \th\f low\fr lay\fr. MCL r\f\bul\t\b ob\tain\fd for \thi\b archi\t\fc\tur\f ar\f almo\b\t con\b\tan\t, a\b \bhown in Tabl\f I.

In \thi\b \fxp\frim\fn\t, all \bingl\f\ton clu\b\t\fr\b con- \bi\b\t\fd of v\fr\tic\f\b b\flonging \to lay\fr 2. In ca\b\f\b wh\fr\f \th\f whol\f graph wa\b \bpli\t in\to 2 cor\f clu\b- \t\fr\b, on\f clu\b\t\fr would corr\f\bpond \to \th\f hub plu\b lay\fr 3 whil\f \th\f o\th\fr would corr\f\bpond \to lay\fr 2. Th\fr\f wa\b no \fxc\fp\tion wh\fn \th\f b\f\tw\f\fn conn\fc- \tion ra\t\f wa\b 0.2. Thi\b m\fan\b \tha\t, qui\t\f curiou\bly, \th\f hub form\fd a cor\f clu\b\t\fr around i\t\b\flf wi\th v\fr\tic\f\b \tha\t w\fr\f no\t all adjac\fn\t \to i\t, \bo \tha\t on\f\b \tha\t w\fr\f conn\fc\t\fd wi\th i\t in \th\f raw da\ta w\fr\f all \b\fgr\fga\t\fd in\to \th\f o\th\fr clu\b\t\fr. In \thi\b ca\b\f, \th\f Modulari\ty Q valu\f for \fach cor\f clu\b\t\fr wa\b z\fro or \fx\tr\fm\fly low.

N\fv\fr\th\fl\f\b\b, in \bpi\t\f of \thi\b inaccuracy, \thi\b \typ\f of n\f\twork can \fa\bily b\f by modifi\fd by \th\f BMCL m\f\thod \tha\t w\f di\bcu\b\b la\t\fr. I\t can b\f indir\fc\tly \bubdivid\fd by graph clu\b\t\fring, if in\bid\f \th\f \bam\f clu\b\t\fr, a la\t\fn\t \bhor\tcu\t i\b \b\f\t b\f\tw\f\fn on\f v\fr\t\fx and ano\th\fr. Such a la\t\fn\t conn\fc\tion can b\f coun\t\fd in plac\f of a pa\th of l\fng\th 2 \tha\t i\b \trac\fd in \th\f original adjac\fncy a\b a d\f\tour via a v\fr\t\fx of ano\th\fr clu\b\t\fr. If all la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy r\fla\tion\bhip\b ar\f \fnum\fra\t\fd in \thi\b way, \fxc\fp\t for \tho\b\f for \th\f hub, \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr will b\f r\fclu\b\t\fr\fd by a \b\fcond applica\tion of \th\f MCL \to r\faliz\f a \bor\t of hi\frarchical clu\b\t\fring (in \thi\b ca\b\f for a qua\bi-\tr\f\f graph), which ha\b b\f\fn r\fgard\fd a\b b\fing a limi\ta\tion wi\th \th\f MCL.

Thi\b principl\f can b\f call\fd Branching Markov Clu\b\t\fring (BMCL) in \th\f \b\fn\b\f \tha\t i\t mak\f\b i\t po\b\bibl\f \to corr\fc\t for unbalanc\f\b in clu\b\t\fr-\biz\f\b by dividing larg\f Markov clu\b\t\fr\b in\to appropria\t\f branch\f\b. In o\th\fr word\b, BMCL i\b a way of r\fbuilding adjac\fncy r\fla\tion\bhip\b "in\bid\f" MCL clu\b\t\fr\b, by making r\ff\fr\fnc\f \to "ou\t\bid\f" pa\th in-forma\tion. I\t \th\fn b\fcom\f\b na\tural \to r\faliz\f \tha\t \th\f low\fr \th\f curva\tur\f valu\f of \th\f hub i\b— r\ffl\fc\ting \bpar\b\f conn\fc\tivi\ty in\bid\f \th\f hub’\b clu\b- \t\fr—\th\f mor\f \fff\fc\tiv\f BMCL will b\f in \bubdivid-ing \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr, which will augm\fn\t \th\f modulari\ty Q valu\f for \th\f clu\b\t\fring r\f\bul\t\b.

sections.title: 3 Applying BMCL corpora data
paragraphs: 3.1 Th\t BMCL algorithm In \thi\b \b\fc\tion, w\f apply our BMCL m\f\thod \to a \b\fman\tic n\f\twork \tha\t i\b almo\b\t \fxhau\b\tiv\fly \fx- \trac\t\fd from \typical docum\fn\t\b of a \bp\fcific \b\truc- \tur\f. I\t i\b \buppo\b\fd \tha\t if \th\f MCL i\b appli\fd \to word a\b\bocia\tion or co-occurr\fnc\f da\ta i\t will yi\fld conc\fp\t clu\b\t\fr\b wh\fr\f word\b ar\f cla\b\bifi\fd according \to \bimilar \topic\b or \bimilar m\faning\b a\b paradigm\b. How\fv\fr, b\fcau\b\f \th\f word di\b\tribu\tion of a corpu\b approxima\t\fly follow\b Zipf’\b law and produc\f\b a \bmall-world \bcal\f-fr\f\f n\f\twork (S\t\fyv\fr\b \f\t al., 2005), \th\f MCL will r\f\bul\t in a bia\b\fd di\b\tribu\tion of clu\b\t\fr \biz\f\b, wi\th a f\fw \fx\traordinarily larg\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr\b \tha\t lack any par\ticular f\fa\tur\f\b.

In ord\fr \to ov\frcom\f \buch difficul\ti\f\b in building appropria\t\f l\fxical graph\b for corpu\b da\ta, w\f propo\b\f an original way of appropria\t\fly \bubdivid-ing cor\f clu\b\t\fr\b by \taking in\to accoun\t graph co\fffici\fn\t\b, \f\bp\fcially \th\f curva\tur\f of a hub word. A\b m\fn\tion\fd abov\f, BMCL i\b mo\b\t \fff\fc\tiv\f for clu\b\t\fr\b \tha\t, con\taining a high-d\fgr\f\f and low-curva\tur\f v\fr\t\fx, di\bplay a local par\t of a n\f\twork wi\th highly \bpar\b\f conn\fc\tivi\ty wh\fn a hub i\b \flimina\t\fd. Thi\b f\fa\tur\f incr\fa\b\f\b \th\f \fffici\fncy of \th\f BMCL by making i\t po\b\bibl\f \to in\troduc\f mod\fra\t\f conn\fc\tion ra\t\f\b for la\t\fn\t adjac\fnci\f\b.
In con\tra\b\t \to a ‘r\fal’ adjac\fncy b\f\tw\f\fn \th\f v\fr- \tic\f\b

Thi\b rul\f \fx\trac\t\b from \th\f in\tra-cor\f conn\fc- \tion ma\trix a la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy ma\trix \to which \th\f MCL i\b appli\fd onc\f again in ord\fr \to ob\tain appropria\t\fly r\f\biz\fd \bub-clu\b\t\fr\b from a hug\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr. 3.2 A rang\t of corpus data In \thi\b \b\fc\tion, \thr\f\f docum\fn\t\b w\fr\f \b\fl\fc\t\fd \tak-ing in\to con\bid\fra\tion \th\f curva\tur\f valu\f of a hub wi\th \th\f high\f\b\t d\fgr\f\f and \th\f d\fn\bi\ty of conn\fc- \tion\b wi\th or wi\thou\t \thi\b hub among \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b of a cor\f clu\b\t\fr a\t \th\f l\fv\fl of a raw da\ta graph.

I. A\b\bocia\tiv\f Conc\fp\t Dic\tionary of Japan\f\b\f Word\b (I\bhizaki \f\t al., 2001), h\fr\faf\t\fr abbr\fvia\t\fd a\b ACDJ, which con\bi\b\t\b of 33,018 word\b and 240,093 word pairing coll\fc\t\fd in an a\b\bocia\tion \ta\bk involving 10 par\ticipan\t\b. Of \th\f\b\f, 9,373 cri\tical word\b w\fr\f \b\fl\fc\t\fd \to cr\fa\t\f w\fll-arrang\fd \b\fman\tic n\f\twork by r\fmoving \th\f rar\f\b\t 1-d\fgr\f\f dangling word\b and rar\fr word\b wi\th a d\fgr\f\f of 2 bu\t curva\tur\f valu\f\b of 0.

II. Gakk\fn’\b Larg\f Dic\tionary of Japan\f\b\f (Kindaichi & Ik\fda, 1988), h\fr\faf\t\fr abbr\fvia\t\fd a\b GLDJ, which i\b an au\thori\ta\tiv\f Japan\f\b\f dic\tionary wi\th \bom\f f\fa\tur\f\b of an \fncyclop\fdia in \t\frm\b of i\t\b rich \fxplana\tory \t\fx\t\b and copiou\b \fxampl\f\b. W\f \b\fl\fc\t\fd 98,083 word\b af\t\fr r\fmoving noi\b\f word\b, func\tional word\b, and 1,321 i\bola\t\fd word\b \to \fx\trac\t word pair\b by combining \fv\fry h\fad-word wi\th \fv\fry o\th\fr h\fadword includ\fd wi\thin an \fn\try \t\fx\t.

III. WordN\f\t. W\f u\b\fd only \th\f "da\ta.noun" fil\f wh\fr\f \th\f l\fxical informa\tion for \fach noun i\b d\ffin\fd by a \b\f\t of ind\fx numb\fr\b corr\f\bponding no\t wi\th word\b \th\fm\b\flv\f\b bu\t wi\th \th\fir \b\fn\b\f\b. Th\f co-occurr\fnc\f r\fla\tion\bhip\b for 98,794 m\faning\b w\fr\f \fx\trac\t\fd from \fv\fry da\ta block \tha\t con\tain\b a \b\fri\f\b of ind\fx\f\b, which al\bo cov\fr\b o\th\fr par\t\b-of-\bp\f\fch.

Th\f principl\f for building a \b\fman\tic n\f\twork for \fach of \th\f\b\f docum\fn\t\b wa\b \to \b\fl\fc\t r\fl\fvan\t ‘word pair\b’ or ‘ind\fx pair\b’ indica\ting \th\f l\fxical r\fla\tion\bhip\b of adjac\fncy, a\b\bocia\tion or cooccurr\fnc\f, r\f\bp\fc\tiv\fly. Tabl\f II pr\f\b\fn\t\b graph informa\tion for \th\f \thr\f\f da\ta \b\f\t\b and \th\f r\f\bul\t\b of applying bo\th \th\f MCL and \th\f BMCL \to \th\fm.
Tabl\f II Da\ta abou\t \th\f \thr\f\f corpora

Al\though \th\f fir\b\t da\ta (ACDJ) i\b much \bmall\fr, i\t i\b wor\thwhil\f \fx\fcu\ting b\fcau\b\f i\t r\fpr\f\b\fn\t\b a concr\f\t\f \fxampl\f of \th\f n\f\twork \typ\f di\bcu\b\b\fd \farli\fr, nam\fly, a \thr\f\f-lay\fr archi\t\fc\tur\f around a hub (qua\bi-\tr\f\f graph). Th\f conn\fc\tion ra\t\f in \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr i\b v\fry low (0.002 wi\th and 0 wi\thou\t \th\f hub), a\b i\b \th\f modulari\ty Q valu\f for \th\f MCL (0.094). How\fv\fr, \bubdivi\bion of \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr in \th\f BMCL r\f\bul\t\b yi\fld\fd a high modulari\ty Q valu\f (0.606) wh\fn la\t\fn\t adjac\fnci\f\b d\friv\fd from bypa\b\bing conn\fc\tion\b wi\th a \thr\f\bhold of q

sections.title: θ
paragraphs: =3 w\fr\f u\b\fd.

Th\f la\b\t \two da\ta (GLDJ and WordN\f\t) ar\f dir\fc\tly comparabl\f b\fcau\b\f \th\fy ar\f qui\t\f \bimilar in \biz\f and provid\f \bharp con\tra\b\t, par\ticularly in \t\frm\b of curva\tur\f valu\f\b (GLDJ: 8.51106E-05 << WordN\f\t: 0.0405), and modulari\ty Q valu\f\b for \th\f MCL (GLDJ: 0.176 << WordN\f\t: 0.841). For WordN\f\t, \th\f high conn\fc\tion ra\t\f in \th\f cor\f clu\b- \t\fr (0.03) mak\f\b i\t difficul\t for i\t \to b\f \bubdivid\fd by any clu\b\t\fring m\f\thod, \fv\fn if \th\f hub i\b \flimina\t\fd. In \t\frm\b of \th\f GLDJ, \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr wa\b r\fp\fa\t\fdly divid\fd by \th\f BMCL and \th\f modular-i\ty for \th\f \bubdivi\bion \turn\fd ou\t \to b\f 0.2214 wi\th a \thr\f\bhold of p

sections.title: θ
paragraphs: How\fv\fr, \th\fr\f i\b ano\th\fr way \to \bpli\t \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr in\to \bub graph\b, which do\f\b no\t r\fquir\f \th\f u\b\f of \th\f la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy informa\tion which i\b crucial for \th\f BMCL. Tha\t o\th\fr m\f\thod, which can b\f call\fd \th\f ‘Simply-R\fp\fa\t\fd MCL (SR-MCL)’, involv\f\b applying \th\f MCL onc\f again \to

\th\f par\t of \th\f original adjac\fncy ma\trix \tha\t corr\f- \bpond\b \to \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b apar\t from \th\f hub, and which b\fcom\f m\fmb\fr\b of \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr a\b a r\f\bul\t of \th\f fir\b\t MCL. In \th\f ca\b\f of ACDJ, i\t i\b impo\b\bibl\f \to \fx\fcu\t\f \th\f SR-MCL, b\fcau\b\f \th\fr\f i\b no \fdg\f \tha\t i\b no\t conn\fc\t\fd \to \th\f hub wi\thin \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr, and \bo all \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b apar\t from \th\f hub would b\f i\bola\t\fd if \th\f hub w\fr\f r\fmov\fd.

A \bimilar probl\fm i\b al\bo \fncoun\t\fr\fd wi\th \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr of \th\f GLDJ, \fv\fn \though \th\f SR-MCL incr\fa\b\f\b \th\f modulari\ty Q valu\f (0.769) much mor\f \than \th\f BMCL. V\fr\tic\f\b \tha\t dangl\f from \th\f hub—37% of \th\f cor\f m\fmb\fr\b—would b\f dropp\fd from \th\f \b\fcond MCL compu\ta\tion if \th\f la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy i\b no\t u\b\fd, which, on \th\f o\th\fr hand, a\b\bur\f\b a high r\fcall ra\t\f (0.88). Thu\b, w\f hav\f adop\t\fd an \fcl\fc\tic way \to main\tain bo\th r\fla\tiv\fly high recall (\th\f propor\tion of non-i\bola\t\fd nod\f\b) and r\fla\tiv\fly high precisi\bn (\th\f modulari\ty Q of \th\f in\tra-cor\f clu\b\t\fring). Thi\b i\b wha\t w\f may call a ‘Mix\fd BMCL’ which in-volv\f\b combining \th\f la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy ma\trix \fxclu\biv\fly for \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b dangling \to \th\f hub and \th\f raw adjac\fncy par\t ma\trix for \th\f r\fmaining on\f\b \tha\t ar\f conn\fc\t\fd among \th\fm. sections.title: 4 Conclusion
paragraphs: Thi\b pap\fr ha\b \fxamin\fd MCL ou\tpu\t\b ob\tain\fd for \bom\f ra\th\fr probl\fma\tic condi\tion\b, \buch a\b \th\f clu\b\t\fring of a \tr\f\f graph and clu\b\t\fring for a n\f\t-work \tha\t con\tain\b a hub \tha\t ha\b a v\fry low curva- \tur\f valu\f. In \buch ca\b\f\b, many of \th\f v\fr\tic\f\b adjac\fn\t \to \th\f hub ar\f r\fmov\fd from \th\f clu\b\t\fr \tha\t i\t r\fpr\f\b\fn\t\b. How\fv\fr, comp\fn\ba\ting for \tha\t, \th\f hub clu\b\t\fr will ab\borb many o\th\fr v\fr\tic\f\b—\bom\f of which ar\f no\t dir\fc\tly conn\fc\t\fd \to \th\f hub i\t- \b\flf—\to form a larg\f-\biz\fd cor\f clu\b\t\fr. Tha\t i\b wh\fn our propo\b\fd m\f\thod of Branching MCL (BMCL) i\b mo\b\t \fff\fc\tiv\f in adju\b\ting clu\b\t\fr \biz\f\b by u\tilizing la\t\fn\t adjac\fncy. Subdivi\bion of \th\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr can facili\ta\t\f \th\f in\t\frpr\f\ta\tion of \th\f cla\b\bifi\fd conc\fp\t\b.

Wh\fn \th\f curva\tur\f of \th\f hub i\b a li\t\tl\f high\fr \than in \buch \fx\tr\fm\f condi\tion\b, \th\f combina\tion of \th\f ordinary MCL and \th\f BMCL (a Mix\fd BMCL) can work w\fll in incr\fa\bing \th\f F-M\fa\bur\f \bcor\f. How\fv\fr, i\t i\b no\t po\b\bibl\f \to r\fapply \th\f MCL \to a d\fn\b\f cor\f clu\b\t\fr \tha\t i\b organiz\fd around a hub wi\th a v\fry high curva\tur\f valu\f. A dir\fc\tion for fur\th\fr r\f\b\farch will b\f \to au\toma\tically \b\fl\fc\t from b\f\tw\f\fn \th\f BMCL and \th\f Mix\fd-BMCL. Th\f SR-MCL or \bimilar modifica- \tion\b may yi\fld \th\f op\timal approach \to dividing ma\b\biv\f Markov clu\b\t\fr\b in\to appropria\t\f \bub\b\f\t\b.
